model_answer: An AF grade is assigned for failure to either drop or complete a course. An "AF" grade is assigned for failure to drop or complete a course.
A "CR" grade is assigned for successful completion, while an "F" grades are assigned for failure.
An AU grade is assigned for completion of courses for which an audit was granted. No credit is earned.

An incomplete grade is assigned with the approval of the instructor for excused unfinished work only. The work must be completed and submitted to the instructor by the date agreed upon with the instructor, but not later than the last day of classes of the semester immediately following the one in which the incomplete was granted (800-­ and 900-level courses only; mid-semester deadline for 400-­, 500-, 600-, and 700-­level courses). If extraordinary circumstances arise, a petition requesting additional time may be submitted.
Incomplete in thesis credit, doctoral research, or other continuing courses of more than one semester.

The specific withdrawal deadlines can be found on the UNH Academic Calendar. Failure to officially withdraw will result in an AF grade, which is maintained on the official student record and included in the grade point average (GPA).
A course may only be repeated once. Only repeated courses taken at UNH will alter the cumulative grade-­point average. Failing a required course for a second time is grounds for dismissal.
